Name: Coptic textile
Description: A tapestry panel with a formal design in red, green and blue on a natural ground and deep peacock blue background. The florets of the motif are red and green in a continuous zigzag, enclosing a plant motif contained in a half shield.Technique: plain weave background with doubled warp and weft, the warp threads plied. The pattern is inlaid, usually over two warp threads, the main zigzag is a variation of 'soumak'.Ends per inch (warp threads): 90 doubled.Picks per inch (weft threads): 32 doubled, over ground.
